name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
description: Tyrannosaurus Rex was one of the largest land predators to ever exist, reaching up to 40 feet in length. It had powerful jaws with serrated teeth capable of crushing bone and likely hunted large herbivorous dinosaurs.

name: Triceratops
description: Triceratops is recognized for its large bony frill and three facial horns. It was a herbivore that likely used its horns for defense against predators and possibly in combat with other Triceratops.

name: Velociraptor
description: Velociraptor was a small but highly intelligent predator, measuring around 6 feet long. It likely hunted in packs and had sharp claws for capturing prey, making it a formidable hunter despite its size.

name: Stegosaurus
description: Stegosaurus was a slow-moving herbivore known for its double row of bony plates along its back and spiked tail, which may have been used for defense against predators.

name: Brachiosaurus
description: Brachiosaurus was a massive sauropod with a long neck, which allowed it to feed on tall trees. It could reach heights of up to 40 feet and weighed tens of tons.

name: Allosaurus
description: Allosaurus was a large predator with sharp teeth and strong legs, enabling it to hunt large herbivorous dinosaurs. It had a powerful bite and a long tail for balance during attacks.

name: Pteranodon
description: Pteranodon was a large flying reptile with a wingspan up to 33 feet. It had a toothless beak and likely fed on fish, soaring over oceans and coastal areas to hunt.

name: Quetzalcoatlus
description: Quetzalcoatlus is the largest known flying animal, with wingspans possibly exceeding 36 feet. It likely hunted small animals and may have scavenged for carrion as well.

name: Dimorphodon
description: Dimorphodon was a small Jurassic pterosaur with two distinct types of teeth, suggesting it ate a variety of prey, including insects and small vertebrates. Its wings allowed agile flight.

name: Crocodylus
description: Crocodylus was an ancient crocodile species, similar to modern crocodiles, that lived in freshwater habitats and preyed on fish, small reptiles, and occasionally dinosaurs.

name: Sarcosuchus
description: Sarcosuchus was an enormous prehistoric crocodile, reaching lengths of up to 40 feet. It had a powerful bite capable of crushing bones and likely preyed on large aquatic and terrestrial animals.

name: Araripesuchus
description: Araripesuchus was a small, agile crocodyliform. It likely fed on insects, small vertebrates, and plant matter, and its slender body helped it move quickly through rivers and forests.

name: Proganochelys
description: Proganochelys is the earliest known turtle, featuring a fully formed shell and teeth unlike modern turtles. It lived in freshwater environments and grazed on vegetation.

name: Archelon
description: Archelon was a giant sea turtle that could grow over 13 feet in length. It had flippers adapted for ocean life and likely fed on jellyfish, squid, and soft-bodied marine animals.

name: Odontochelys
description: Odontochelys was an early turtle with primitive teeth, unlike modern turtles. It had a partial shell and probably ate both plants and small aquatic animals.

name: Ankylosaurus
description: Ankylosaurus had a heavily armored body and a club-like tail for defense. It fed on low-lying plants and was nearly impervious to attacks by large predators.

name: Diplodocus
description: Diplodocus was a long-necked, whip-tailed sauropod that fed on conifers and other plants. It could reach over 80 feet in length, making it one of the longest dinosaurs.

name: Iguanodon
description: Iguanodon was a large herbivore with thumb spikes possibly used for defense. It traveled in herds and could reach lengths of around 30 feet.

name: Spinosaurus
description: Spinosaurus was a massive carnivorous dinosaur with a sail-like structure on its back. It may have been semi-aquatic, hunting fish as well as terrestrial prey.

name: Microraptor
description: Microraptor was a tiny, four-winged feathered dinosaur capable of gliding between trees. It likely preyed on small animals and insects in forested environments.

name: Plesiosaurus
description: Plesiosaurus was a marine reptile with a long neck, paddle-like limbs, and a small head, adapted for catching fish and squid in the oceans.

name: Liopleurodon
description: Liopleurodon was a large marine predator with massive jaws and sharp teeth. It hunted other marine reptiles and large fish in the Jurassic seas.

name: Mosasaurus
description: Mosasaurus was a gigantic marine lizard, growing up to 50 feet in length. It was an apex predator, feeding on fish, ammonites, and smaller marine reptiles.

name: Elasmosaurus
description: Elasmosaurus had an extremely long neck and small head, which it likely used to stealthily catch fish. Its paddle-like limbs allowed it to navigate through oceans efficiently.

name: Kronosaurus
description: Kronosaurus was a massive pliosaur with strong jaws capable of crushing prey, including large fish and other marine reptiles. It was a top predator in its environment.

name: Ichthyosaurus
description: Ichthyosaurus was a dolphin-like marine reptile built for speed. It had a streamlined body and hunted fish and squid in the shallow seas of the Jurassic period.

name: Stygimoloch
description: Stygimoloch was a small dinosaur with a high dome skull and spikes, possibly used for head-butting during intraspecies combat. It fed mainly on plants and fruits.

name: Therizinosaurus
description: Therizinosaurus was a bizarre dinosaur with extremely long claws, which may have been used for pulling down branches or defense. It was a slow-moving herbivore.

name: Gigantoraptor
description: Gigantoraptor was a huge feathered dinosaur, possibly omnivorous, feeding on plants, small animals, and eggs. It was one of the largest feathered dinosaurs discovered.

name: Gallimimus
description: Gallimimus was a fast and agile dinosaur that could reach speeds up to 40 mph. It likely fed on small animals, plants, and insects and traveled in flocks for protection.

name: Pachycephalosaurus
description: Pachycephalosaurus had a thick, domed skull that could reach up to 10 inches thick. It may have used its skull for head-butting during combat or display, and it fed mainly on plants and seeds.

name: Megaraptor
description: Megaraptor was a large predatory dinosaur with massive, clawed hands. It was a fast and agile hunter, capable of taking down prey larger than itself using its powerful claws.

name: Suchomimus
description: Suchomimus had a long, slender snout similar to a crocodile’s, filled with sharp teeth. It primarily hunted fish but may have occasionally scavenged or caught small terrestrial animals.

name: Plateosaurus
description: Plateosaurus was a classic Triassic herbivore, measuring up to 30 feet in length. It had strong legs and a long neck, allowing it to reach high vegetation, and likely lived in herds for protection.

name: Herrerasaurus
description: Herrerasaurus is one of the earliest known predatory dinosaurs, about 10–20 feet long. It had sharp teeth and claws, making it an efficient hunter of smaller reptiles and early herbivores.

name: Apatosaurus
description: Apatosaurus was a massive, long-necked sauropod that could reach over 70 feet in length. Its long tail and neck helped it reach vegetation far from the ground, feeding on ferns and conifers.

name: Camarasaurus
description: Camarasaurus was a robust sauropod with a boxy head and strong teeth for crushing tough plant material. It lived in herds and may have migrated to find food throughout the Jurassic forests.

name: Ornitholestes
description: Ornitholestes was a small, agile predator that relied on speed and agility to hunt small dinosaurs, mammals, and insects. Its long legs and tail helped maintain balance during fast pursuits.

name: Compsognathus
description: Compsognathus was a tiny, fast dinosaur about the size of a turkey. It hunted insects, small lizards, and other tiny prey, using its speed and agility to escape larger predators.

name: Oviraptor
description: Oviraptor was a small, toothless dinosaur once mistakenly thought to steal eggs. It likely fed on a variety of foods, including plants, small animals, and eggs, and had a beak adapted for pecking and tearing.

name: Carnotaurus
description: Carnotaurus was a fast, predatory dinosaur with distinctive horns above its eyes and tiny forelimbs. It relied on speed and agility to hunt medium-sized prey.

name: Pachyrhinosaurus
description: Pachyrhinosaurus was a horned dinosaur with a thickened nasal boss instead of a horn. It lived in herds and grazed on low-lying vegetation.

name: Deinonychus
description: Deinonychus was a highly intelligent predator, with sickle-shaped claws on each foot for slashing prey, and likely hunted in packs.

name: Kentrosaurus
description: Kentrosaurus was a small stegosaurid with spikes along its back and tail, used for defense against predators in Jurassic forests.

name: Giraffatitan
description: Giraffatitan was a gigantic sauropod, closely related to Brachiosaurus, with an extremely long neck to reach treetops for feeding.

name: Ceratosaurus
description: Ceratosaurus was a medium-sized predator with distinctive nasal horns and blade-like teeth, hunting smaller dinosaurs and reptiles.

name: Rhamphorhynchus
description: Rhamphorhynchus was a small, long-tailed pterosaur that hunted fish near lakes and rivers using its needle-like teeth.

name: Ornithocheirus
description: Ornithocheirus was a large flying reptile with a wingspan exceeding 20 feet, feeding primarily on fish caught while soaring over rivers and coasts.

name: Pterodactylus
description: Pterodactylus was a small pterosaur with a lightweight body and long wings, allowing it to glide and hunt insects and small prey efficiently.

name: Deinosuchus
description: Deinosuchus was a giant prehistoric crocodile, capable of preying on large dinosaurs near rivers and lakes with its powerful jaws.

name: Purussaurus
description: Purussaurus was a massive South American crocodile, with a length over 30 feet, dominating rivers and preying on large fish and mammals.

name: Baurusuchus
description: Baurusuchus was a terrestrial predator with a deep skull and serrated teeth, hunting dinosaurs and other small animals in South America.

name: Kayentachelys
description: Kayentachelys was an early turtle with a mix of primitive and modern features, feeding on small plants, insects, and aquatic invertebrates.

name: Protostega
description: Protostega was a giant sea turtle with a leathery shell, feeding on jellyfish and soft-bodied marine creatures in shallow seas.

name: Sinaspider
description: Sinaspider was an early turtle with both teeth and a partially formed shell, feeding on plants, insects, and small aquatic prey.

name: Euoplocephalus
description: Euoplocephalus was an armored dinosaur with a clubbed tail and rows of bony plates, used to defend itself from predators.

name: Barosaurus
description: Barosaurus was a long-necked sauropod, closely related to Diplodocus, feeding high up in the treetops and moving in herds.

name: Ouranosaurus
description: Ouranosaurus had a distinctive sail on its back and was a large herbivore that fed on plants in North Africa.

name: Giganotosaurus
description: Giganotosaurus was one of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs, preying on huge herbivores with powerful jaws and sharp teeth.

name: Rahonavis
description: Rahonavis was a small, feathered dinosaur with wings capable of gliding, hunting insects and small vertebrates in Cretaceous forests.

name: Tarchia
description: Tarchia was a heavily armored ankylosaur with a wide, flat body and a large club at the end of its tail, used to defend against predators.

name: Styracosaurus
description: Styracosaurus was a ceratopsid dinosaur notable for its long nose horn and multiple spikes on its frill, which likely deterred predators.

name: Utahraptor
description: Utahraptor was a giant dromaeosaurid with massive sickle claws, likely hunting in packs to take down large herbivorous dinosaurs.

name: Huayangosaurus
description: Huayangosaurus was a small stegosaurid with bony plates and spikes along its back and tail, providing protection from predators.

name: Amargasaurus
description: Amargasaurus had a double row of elongated spines along its neck and back, possibly supporting a sail for display or thermoregulation.

name: Yangchuanosaurus
description: Yangchuanosaurus was a large theropod predator with strong jaws and sharp teeth, preying on medium to large herbivorous dinosaurs.

name: Dsungaripterus
description: Dsungaripterus was a pterosaur with a robust beak adapted to crushing shellfish and other hard-shelled prey along shorelines.

name: Hatzegopteryx
description: Hatzegopteryx was one of the largest known pterosaurs, with a wingspan estimated at 36 feet, dominating the skies over its island habitat.

name: Anurognathus
description: Anurognathus was a tiny, agile pterosaur that likely fed on insects, using its broad wings for rapid aerial maneuvers.

name: Razanandrongobe
description: Razanandrongobe was a giant prehistoric crocodylomorph with a powerful jaw, capable of crushing bones of large prey.

name: Gryposuchus
description: Gryposuchus was a long-snouted gharial-like crocodile that dominated South American rivers, feeding on fish and smaller aquatic animals.

name: Kaprosuchus
description: Kaprosuchus, the 'Boar Croc', had tusk-like teeth and was adapted for hunting on land as well as water, ambushing prey near rivers.

name: Kallokibotion
description: Kallokibotion was a small aquatic turtle with a domed shell, feeding on soft plants and small aquatic invertebrates.

name: Ocepechelon
description: Ocepechelon was a giant sea turtle with a long, tube-like snout adapted to suction feeding on small fish and jellyfish.

name: Meiolania
description: Meiolania was a heavily armored terrestrial turtle with spiked tails and horns on its head, browsing on shrubs and low plants.

name: Nodosaurus
description: Nodosaurus was a medium-sized armored dinosaur with bony nodules along its body, providing protection from carnivorous predators.

name: Amphicoelias
description: Amphicoelias was one of the longest known sauropods, with an extremely long neck and tail, feeding high in the trees.

name: Tenontosaurus
description: Tenontosaurus was a large, medium-built herbivore with strong limbs for moving quickly, feeding on ferns and low vegetation.

name: Suchomimus
description: Suchomimus was a spinosaurid with a long crocodile-like snout, using conical teeth to catch fish and small aquatic prey.

name: Buitreraptor
description: Buitreraptor was a small, feathered dinosaur from South America, likely hunting in groups to catch small reptiles and mammals.
